value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.title: How to get started with Azure API Management | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to get started with Azure API Management, a service that helps protect and manage your APIs.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today

value.title: AI business school for manufacturing
value.excerpt: Learn to develop an enterprise AI strategy to create business value in manufacturing, including machine learning technologies, and culture.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, use cases, and special factors of an enterprise AI strategy that creates real business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in manufacturing
topItems.excerpt: Explore the strategic components, special factors, and use cases of an AI strategy in manufacturing that creates business value, with INSEAD and Microsoft.

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: Understand the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and a framework to drive the change needed in your organization for a successful AI strategy.

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: Learn the necessary cultural changes for enterprise finance organizations to make AI transformation successful, and how they fit into a holistic AI strategy.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: AZ-400: Facilitate communication and collaboration
value.excerpt: Explore DevOps capabilities such as continuous planning and continuous collaboration and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
topItems.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

topItems.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
topItems.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

topItems.title: Characterize DevOps Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement.

topItems.title: Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality.

value.title: Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Azure Static Web Apps is a modern web app service that offers streamlined full-stack development from source code to global high availability.

topItems.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps. Use Visual Studio Code to create and run the web app locally.

topItems.title: Publish an API to Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

topItems.title: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps

topItems.title: Create and publish a static web app with Gatsby and Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Use Gatsby to develop and compile a static web app, then deploy it to the web with Azure Static Web Apps.

value.title: Build applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to collaborate with others to continuously build, test, and verify your applications using Azure Pipelines and GitHub.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Implement a code workflow in your build pipeline by using Git and GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn along with the Space Game web team the benefits of collaboration through Visual Studio Code and GitHub.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Create an enterprise-scale architecture in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore how to create Azure landing zone architecture at enterprise scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to enterprise-scale landing zones in the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure provides many landing zone options. In this module, we'll focus on enterprise-scale landing zones.

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles

value.title: Deploy a website to Azure with Azure App Service
value.excerpt: In this learning path, get acquainted with using Azure App Service to create and deploy your website without underlying servers, storage or network assets.

topItems.title: Prepare your development environment for Azure development
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to choose and install the appropriate IDE for your requirements to help you build, deploy, monitor, and scale cloud-hosted solutions.

topItems.title: Host a web application with Azure App service
topItems.excerpt: Create a website in the programming language of your choice through the hosted web app platform in Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Publish a web app to Azure with Visual Studio
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure App Service to create a new ASP.NET-based web app, then publish and update directly from Visual Studio.

topItems.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
topItems.excerpt: Discover the benefits of creating deployment slots to streamline deployment and roll back a web app in Azure App Service.

value.title: Introduce DevOps Dojo: Create efficiencies that support your business
value.excerpt: Start your DevOps Dojo journey.  Create multidisciplinary DevOps teams by using shared tools and processes that are designed to make your organizations software development and implementation projects more efficient.

topItems.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
topItems.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

topItems.title: Define the foundation pillars of DevOps: Architecture and Technology
topItems.excerpt: There are three things required to make DevOps happen: the cultural component, tools and technology, and architecture. Discover the last two foundation pillars of DevOps, Architecture and Technology!

topItems.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
topItems.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

topItems.title: Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality.

value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to customize NoSQL data storage and distribution with the Azure portal, Cosmos DB extension, and Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

topItems.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

topItems.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
topItems.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

topItems.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
topItems.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: One Dev Question on Azure

topItems.title: The relationship between an authorization request and tokens | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains how authorization requests are connected to access tokens and refresh tokens.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-v2-protocols?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-AzureIdent

topItems.title: What types of managed identities exist? | One Dev Question: Arturo Lucatero
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Arturo Lucatero, a Senior Program Manager working on managed identities for Azure resources, explains the different types of managed identities in the Microsoft identity platform.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/rbac-and-directory-admin-roles

topItems.title: The difference between, ID, access, refresh, and session tokens? | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between identity, access, refresh, and session tokens.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/access-tokens?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-AzureIdent

topItems.title: What types of Azure RBAC role definitions exist? | One Dev Question: Arturo Lucatero
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Arturo Lucatero, a Senior Program Manager working on Azure role-based access control (RBAC), explains the various types of Azure role-based access control definitions. value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
value.excerpt: Discover the tools that Azure provides to help you design a secure environment throughout your infrastructure, data, network, and applications.

value.title: Control Azure services with the CLI
value.excerpt: Learn the steps to install the Azure CLI locally, create a website, and manage Azure resources using the CLI.

value.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
value.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Fundamentals of network security
value.excerpt: Explore the fundamentals of computer networking security and monitoring.

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azures role-based access control to effectively manage your teams access to Azure resources.

value.title: How to create an Azure SQL database | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal How To Series, you will learn how to create an Azure SQL Database in the Azure Portal and how you can be more productive in Azure.    Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

value.title: Ingest, prepare & transform using Azure Databricks & Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Today's business managers depend heavily on reliable data integration systems that run complex ETL/ELT workflows (extract, transform/load and load/transform data). Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can iteratively build, debug, deploy, and monitor your data integration workflows

value.title: Azure Portal How To Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to build tabs and alerts in Azure workbooks | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In workbooks, you can build complex reports but may need a way to segment information in different sections. In this video, you will learn how to build tabs for sections of reports and how to use Azure Monitor Alerts data to integrate into your workbooks.      Try out these features in the Azure portal:

topItems.title: How to get a visualization view of your resources | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal How To Series, learn how to easily view a summary of your resources using different visualizations such as how to view all your resources on a map.
